cultures.name: Yoruba
cultures.description: The Yoruba people are one of the largest ethnic groups in West Africa, known for their rich artistic traditions, complex social structures, and spiritual practices.

cultures.name: Igbo
cultures.description: The Igbo people are known for their democratic governance, artistic excellence, and strong community bonds. They have a rich tradition of masquerades and visual arts.

cultures.name: Hausa
cultures.description: The Hausa people are known for their trade networks, Islamic traditions, and distinctive textile and leather crafts.

festivals.name: Sango Festival
festivals.significance: Honoring the Orisha Sango, god of thunder and lightning
festivals.description: Annual celebration featuring drumming, dancing, and spiritual rituals. The festival honors Sango, one of the most important Orishas in Yoruba spirituality.

festivals.name: Osun-Osogbo Festival
festivals.significance: Honoring the Orisha Osun, goddess of fertility and beauty
festivals.description: Sacred festival with processions, prayers, and artistic performances. Celebrates the river goddess Osun and includes traditional ceremonies.

festivals.name: Iri-Ji Festival (New Yam Festival)
festivals.description: The new yam is presented to the community, followed by feasting and celebrations. This festival marks the beginning of the harvest season.

festivals.name: Durbar Festival
festivals.significance: Celebration of Islamic holidays with horse parades
festivals.description: Elaborate horse parades featuring traditional rulers and community celebrations. One of the most colorful festivals in Nigeria.

art_forms.name: Adire
art_forms.description: Traditional indigo-dyed fabric with resist patterns. Adire is a symbol of Yoruba identity and craftsmanship.

art_forms.name: Yoruba Beadwork
art_forms.description: Intricate beaded garments and accessories used in royal ceremonies and celebrations.

art_forms.name: Mbari Art
art_forms.description: Elaborate mud structures with carved figures. Mbari houses are sacred spaces built to honor deities.

art_forms.name: Uli Art
art_forms.description: Geometric patterns using natural dyes. Uli is used for body decoration and wall painting.

art_forms.name: Hausa Textiles
art_forms.description: Indigo-dyed cloth with traditional patterns. Hausa textiles are renowned for their quality and design.

traditions.name: Yoruba Masquerade
traditions.description: Sacred masked performances with spiritual significance. Masquerades are used for spiritual communication and community bonding.
traditions.significance: Spiritual communication, ancestral veneration, community bonding

traditions.name: Naming Ceremony
traditions.description: Formal naming of newborns with cultural significance. The ceremony establishes the child's identity and connection to ancestors.
traditions.significance: Establishing child's identity and connection to ancestors

traditions.name: Igbo Masquerade
traditions.description: Elaborate masked performances with cultural narratives. Used for entertainment and social commentary.

traditions.name: Bride Price
traditions.description: Traditional marriage negotiation and gift exchange. Establishes family bonds and social status.
traditions.significance: Establishing family bonds and social status

languages.name: Yoruba
languages.description: Tonal language with complex grammar. Yoruba is spoken by millions across West Africa.

languages.name: Igbo
languages.description: Niger-Congo language with multiple dialects. Igbo is spoken primarily in Southeast Nigeria.

languages.name: Hausa
languages.description: Afro-Asiatic language widely spoken in West Africa. Hausa is a lingua franca in the region.

proverbs.text: A single hand cannot tie a bundle
proverbs.meaning: Cooperation and unity are essential for success

proverbs.text: The lizard that jumped from the high Iroko tree to the ground said he would praise himself if no one else did
proverbs.meaning: Self-reliance and confidence in one's abilities

proverbs.text: A single hand cannot tie a bundle
The dog that trots about finds a bone
proverbs.meaning: Effort and persistence lead to success
